Sentencas: The relations between morphology and electrochemical performance of Ni/yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) anodes are investigated.
Titulo: Structure/performance relations for Ni/yttria-stabilized zirconia anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Four types of anodes are prepared on YSZ electrolyte three-electrode pellets.
Titulo: Structure/performance relations for Ni/yttria-stabilized zirconia anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A fine cermet of 0.5-1 mu m particles, a coarse cermet of 2-3 mu m particles, a porous Ni-paste anode, and a Ni-felt anode.
Titulo: Structure/performance relations for Ni/yttria-stabilized zirconia anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The anodes are characterized by impedance spectroscopy at open-circuit potential, and the electrode relevant part (polarization resistance, Rp) Of the spectra is identified and investigated.
Titulo: Structure/performance relations for Ni/yttria-stabilized zirconia anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The active thickness of the fine cermet anode is demonstrated to be about 10 mu m and is believed to relate to the conductivity of the YSZ network.
Titulo: Structure/performance relations for Ni/yttria-stabilized zirconia anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In the temperature range 850-1000 degrees C, Rp exhibits an apparent activation energy which increases with coarseness of the anode.
Titulo: Structure/performance relations for Ni/yttria-stabilized zirconia anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: No significant dependence on p(H2) (0.01-0.97 atm) at 1000 degrees C is observed.
Titulo: Structure/performance relations for Ni/yttria-stabilized zirconia anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A dependence on p(H2O) of about R-p proportional to p(H2O-1/2) is found.
Titulo: Structure/performance relations for Ni/yttria-stabilized zirconia anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Physical transport limitations are suggested as possible causes for the observed anode polarization.
Titulo: Structure/performance relations for Ni/yttria-stabilized zirconia anodes for solid oxide fuel cells
